intro: Hieracium myurolepis, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It features serrated leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium myurolepis is often found in disturbed habitats and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
